attributes.action: Restrict the number of betting shops, bookmakers or gambling facilities on the high street as easy access to these has a detrimental impact on the community
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Easy access or wide availability to betting shops has a detrimental impact on the community.  Green lanes in North London, for example, is overrun with new betting shops thanks to changes in the law in the Gambling Act of 2005.  

These outlets do very little to benefit the community and in fact, there is an increased social cost of gambling to the community.

The government must restrict the number of betting shops allowed in an area, or within a certain radius.  To do this, it needs to modify the Gambling Act.

By the end of 2009, it is estimated that 1,500 new betting shops will open across Britain (Too many bookies? You bet!, Guardian, 12 January, 2008).  
How does the community stand to benefit?
